messages.subject: Re:Kentucky
messages.msgSnippet: Diane, I wish I could tell you more about unschoolers in Kentucky.  I personally have not met anyone else in my area.  The groups that I have tried to
messages.messageBody:
Diane,

I wish I could tell you more about unschoolers in Kentucky. I personally have not met
anyone else in my area. The groups that I have tried to participate in are either
religious or "home" school related. I haven't met anyone on this list from Kentucky
either. Until now. Again, I wish I could tell you more.

Sherri

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Kentucky
messages.msgSnippet: Sherri! Great to hear that! I d heard that there were unschoolers in Louisville! Are there? (I mean enough to have a group--I can *see* that there are *some!)
messages.messageBody:
Sherri!

Great to hear that! I'd heard that there were unschoolers in Louisville!
Are there? (I mean enough to have a group--I can *see* that there are
*some!) We were hoping to find some. We're in Lexington, and would find
it extremely worthwhile to drive to Louisville to meet people.

:-) Diane

><Here in KY, people seem very worried more about social
>< issues (will the neighbors or people at Wal-Mart call social
>< dis-services) than about legal homeschooling issues.
>
>Diane,
>
>I was just curious to know what part of Kentucky you live in.
>I unschool my dd age 10, in Louisville,Ky.
>
>Sherri
>

messages.subject: Kentucky
messages.messageBody:
<Here in KY, people seem very worried more about social
< issues (will the neighbors or people at Wal-Mart call social
< dis-services) than about legal homeschooling issues.

Diane,

I was just curious to know what part of Kentucky you live in.
I unschool my dd age 10, in Louisville,Ky.

Sherri
